metadata.synopsis: Astarion meets a Gur Hunter that reveals he's hunting a vampire spawn - Astarion himself, although the hunter doesn't realise this. Astarion starts with a mocking tone, but once he realises the hunter's purpose he tries to get some information before leaving or killing the hunter.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game as Astarion2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag ORI_Astarion_Knows_Vampireness4. goto -22.73, 7.68, 241.08. The swamp illusion check will trigger.5. Speak to Gandrel.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

5.speaker: Gandrel
5.text: Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were wandering cut-throats.
52.context: NodeContext: Doesn't think much of Gur.

27.speaker: Gandrel
27.text: Not just cut-throats! We're thieves, con artists, vagrants - the list goes on.
27.context: NodeContext: Joking in response to your stereotype of his people

38.speaker: Gandrel
38.text: I wish I had half the power you settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer, on the hunt.
38.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: And what is your prey exactly? Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?
32.context: NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

11.speaker: Gandrel
11.text: Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.context: NodeContext: is going to say 'a vampire spawn??' in shock, but catches himself.

2.speaker: Gandrel
2.text: I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: And return him to Baldur's Gate, no doubt?
56.context: NodeContext: Darkly. Astarion realises he'll have to kill this hunter.

34.speaker: Gandrel
34.text: ...What do you know of this creature?

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: Oh, I know everything about him.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: bares fangsNodeContext: bares fangs in response to 'what do you know of this creature?'

10.speaker: Gandrel
10.text: It can't be. It's not possible.
10.context: NodeContext: You see your prey in front of you - a vampire standing in the sunlight. After this line, it goes straight to combat.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

20.speaker: Gandrel
20.text: Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: It'd make me think twice, certainly.

50.speaker: Gandrel
50.text: I fear it is needed. I am hunting a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.

29.speaker: Gandrel
29.text: A vile little creature: a vampire spawn named Astarion.

57.speaker: Gandrel
57.text: Are you all right, my friend? You look a little pale.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surprise on Astarion's faceNodeContext: Noticed the look of shock on Astarion's face.

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: And when you find him? Will you kill this Astarion?

24.speaker: Gandrel
24.text: As much as I'd like to, no.

12.speaker: Gandrel
12.text: I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.

31.speaker: Gandrel
31.text: I am to return him to Baldur's Gate alive. Or as close to 'alive' as a vampire gets.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: I've just remembered I need to be somewhere. But good luck with your hunt.

51.speaker: Gandrel
51.text: And good luck to you, my friend. Be safe.

19.speaker: Gandrel
19.text: My people were recently attacked in the night - our camp set upon by a band of vampire spawn.

36.speaker: Gandrel
36.text: In the chaos of battle, one of them stole away with our children. We have been searching for them ever since.

62.speaker: Gandrel
62.text: We believe this Astarion knows exactly what happened that night, and where to find our little ones.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *You remember the night well. The shouts of battle, the screams of the children as you dragged them away...*

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: I wouldn't blame the vampire spawn - I hear they have to follow their master's orders.

60.speaker: Gandrel
60.text: Monsters are monsters. And whatever his reasons, the monster still knows where our children are.

55.speaker: Gandrel
55.context: NodeContext: Astarion - a vampire -is standing in front of you in broad daylight. After this line, you immediately go into combat.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: How do you plan to find him?

15.speaker: Gandrel
15.text: I am hoping the hag of these lands can help me. If I could afford her price.
15.context: NodeContext: He knows her price will be high - not just financially, it'll cost him something dear to him.

41.speaker: Gandrel
41.text: I've been hunting at night, but not found any trace of my prey.

58.speaker: Gandrel
58.text: He cannot hide forever, though. I will catch him and return him to Baldur's Gate.

40.speaker: Gandrel
40.text: I had hoped the hag of these lands could help me, but it seems she is no more. For the best, perhaps.
40.context: NodeContext: The hag is dead. She could have been useful, but she was a monster. He has mixed feelings about her being killed.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: I'm feeling a little ill, actually. I should go.

49.speaker: Gandrel
49.text: Of course. Be safe on your travels.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: You're in the right place - there's plenty of evil here.

44.speaker: Gandrel
44.text: I seek only one evil: a vampire spawn named Astarion.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: Well, you stink. I'm sure that'll protect you.

14.speaker: Gandrel
14.text: I hope so. Anything that discourages a bite. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Why should I believe anything you say?

9.speaker: Gandrel
9.text: Believe or don't. It changes nothing about my mission. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.
9.context: NodeContext: Gandrel doesn't care either way.

39.speaker: Gandrel
39.text: Well, not a true vampire. A spawn named Astarion.
39.context: NodeContext: A vampire spawn isn't a 'real' vampire after all.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: I've met people like you before. You're a Gur, aren't you?

35.speaker: Gandrel
35.text: Guilty. My people are wanderers - we travel across Faerûn, doing what good we can, where we can.

47.speaker: Gandrel
47.text: Here, I will rid this land of a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Funny. I thought your people were all cut-throats, not monster hunters.
